isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - POWER TAKE OFF: ROCKWELL REAR ENGINE MOUNTED - ASSEMBLE

note.para: Outer rings and tolerance rings must form a butt joint (never overlap). If necessary, cut or grind one end to achieve the correct installed diameter. When installing the tolerance ring, align the butt joint 180 degrees away from the outer ring butt joint.

step1.para: Apply Loctite 277 to the I.D. of the drive gear and output shaft bearing bores. Apply Loctite 680 to the idler gear bearing bore. Use a swab to evenly spread a light coating ( Figure 13).

figure.caption: Figure 13. Use Swab to Evenly Spread a Light Coating

step1.para: Install the outer rings into the bearing bores of the gear cover and the PTO housing ( Figure 14).

figure.caption: Figure 14. Install Outer Rings into Bearing Bores

step1.para: Install the tolerance rings into the gear cover bearing bores ( Figure 15). The tabs on the tolerance ring must be to the bottom of the bearing bore. The butt joint in the installed tolerance ring must be 180 degrees away from the butt joint in the outer ring.

figure.caption: Figure 15. Install Tolerance Rings into Gear Cover Bearing Bores

step1.para: Mount the gear case cover in a press and install the bearings into the gear cover bores ( Figure 16). Prelube the bearings with engine lube prior to installing them.

figure.caption: Figure 16. Install Bearings into Gear Cover Bores

caution.para: Exercise caution not to cock the bearings, otherwise the cover can crack.
Press the bearing on the outer race to prevent bearing damage.

step1.para: Install the cover O-ring. Use dabs of Permatex to hold the O-ring in place ( Figure 17and Figure 18).

figure.caption: Figure 17. Install Cover O-Ring
Figure 18. Use Permatex to Hold O-Ring in Place

step1.para: Apply an even coat of Loctite 277 to the inner bore of the output shaft. Install an outer ring and tolerance ring into the inner bearing bore of the output shaft ( Figure 19). Tabs on the tolerance ring should be at the bottom of the bearing bore. The outer ring and tolerance ring butt joints must be 180 degrees apart.

figure.caption: Figure 19. Install Outer Ring and Tolerance Ring

step1.para: Use a press and suitable fixture to install the prelubed bearing into the inner PTO bearing bore. The bearing must be seated against the shoulder in the bore ( Figure 20).

figure.caption: Figure 20. Install Prelubed Bearing into Inner PTO Bearing Bore

step1.para: Position the PTO gear, long hub toward the output, in the bore ( Figure 21).

figure.caption: Figure 21. Position PTO Gear in Bore

step1.para: Install the inner snap ring in the PTO output bore and bearing spacer on the output shaft ( Figure 22).

figure.caption: Figure 22. Install Inner Snap Ring in PTO Output Bore

step1.para: Apply an even coat of Loctite 277 to the outer bearing bore. Install the outer ring and tolerance ring with tabs to the bottom of the bore. Butt joint of rings must be 180 degrees apart.
Install the PTO shaft with spacer through the PTO gear splines and use a press to engage the inner bearing ( Figure 23).

figure.caption: Figure 23. Use Press to Engage Inner Bearing

caution.para: Press the bearing on the outer race to prevent bearing damage.

step1.para: Install the outer PTO bearing using a press and suitable fixture. Seat the bearing against the snap ring ( Figure 24).

figure.caption: Figure 24. Seat Bearing Against Snap Ring

step1.para: Install the outer snap ring ( Figure 25).

figure.caption: Figure 25. Install Outer Snap Ring

step1.para: Apply an even coat of Loctite 680 to the idler gear bore. Install an outer ring and tolerance ring into the idler gear bore with tolerance ring tabs at the bottom of bore. Butt joint of rings must be 180 degrees apart ( Figure 26and Figure 27).

figure.caption: Figure 26. Install Outer Ring and Tolerance Ring
Figure 27. Install Outer Ring and Tolerance Ring

step1.para: Apply an even coat of Loctite 277 to the drive gear bore. Install an outer ring and tolerance ring into the drive gear bore with tolerance ring tabs at bottom of bore. Ring butt joints must be 180 degrees apart.

caution.para: Press on the outer race to prevent bearing damage.

step1.para: Use a press and suitable fixture to install the idler and drive gear bearings into position ( Figure 28).

figure.caption: Figure 28. Install Idler and Drive Gear Bearings

step1.para: Install the idler gear assembly into the housing. Use a press and suitable fixture to seat it in the bearing making sure the teeth are in mesh with the PTO gear teeth ( Figure 29and Figure 30).

figure.caption: Figure 29. Install Idler Gear Assembly
Figure 30. Install Idler Gear Assembly

step1.para: Install the drive gear, long hub facing up, into the bearing. Use a press and suitable fixture to seat it in the bearing making sure the teeth are in mesh with the idler gear ( Figure 31).

figure.caption: Figure 31. Install Drive Gear

step1.para: Apply a bead of silastic sealer around the gear cover bolt holes and O-ring ( Figure 32).

figure.caption: Figure 32. Apply Silastic Sealer Around Gear Cover Bolt Holes

step1.para: Lubricate the O-rings with engine lube.
Install (2) O-rings on the gear case cover support dowel.
Install the support dowel into the PTO housing ( Figure 33).

figure.caption: Figure 33. Install Support Dowel into PTO Housing

step1.para: Install the gear cover on the housing ( Figure 34).

figure.caption: Figure 34. Install Gear Cover on Housing

step1.para: Apply Loctite 277 to the support dowel bolt ( Figure 35).

figure.caption: Figure 35. Apply Loctite 277 to Support Dowel Bolt

step1.para: Install the bolt but do not tighten.
To align the gear case cover, install 4 cover bolts and washers near the corners of the cover with Loctite on the threads. Do not tighten.

Press the cover over the drive and idler gears. Alternate the pressure from side to side so as not to cock the gear cover. Make sure the O-ring is in place before making contact with the housing ( Figure 36).

figure.caption: Figure 36. Press Cover Over Drive and Idler Gears

step1.para: Install the remaining bolts with washers and Loctite 277 on the threads.
Tighten all gear case cover bolts to 40 to 55 ft-lbs. (54 to 75 N·m) of torque.
Install 2 one inch NPTF pipe plugs. Tighten to 40 to 55 ft-lbs. (54 to 75 N·m) of torque.
Install two 5/16-24 short bolts in the cover at the idler gear location to plug the holes. Use Loctite 277 on the threads. Tighten to 20 to 30 ft-lbs. (27 to 41 N·m).
Install the drive gear oil seal using tool number ZTSE-4433 ( Figure 37). Do not pre- lube the seal lips.

figure.caption: Figure 37. Install Drive Gear Oil Seal

step1.para: Apply a light film of engine oil to the output seal lip. Use a press and suitable fixture to install the PTO output seal until it bottoms in the bore.
Apply a light film of engine oil to the excluder seal lip. Use a press and suitable fixture to install the excluder seal (seal lip facing out) flush with the face of the bore ( Figure 38).

figure.caption: Figure 38. Install Excluder Seal

step1.para: Install the output shaft yoke/flange on the PTO shaft ( Figure 39).

figure.caption: Figure 39. Install Output Shaft Yoke/Flange on PTO Shaft

step1.para: Apply a thin coat of Loctite 277 to both sides of the washer and install on the yoke/flange ( Figure 40).

figure.caption: Figure 40. Apply Loctite 277 to Both Sides of Washer

step1.para: Apply Loctite 277 to the nut threads. Install the yoke/flange nut. Tighten to 350 to 400 ft-lbs. (475 to 542 N·m) of torque ( Figure 41).

figure.caption: Figure 41. Apply Loctite 277 to Nut Threads
